description: Borrowed from French fulminer, from Latin fulminō (“lighten, illuminate”). More at fulminate.

verbs.description: fulmine (third-person singular simple present fulmines, present participle fulmining, simple past and past participle fulmined)

entries.meaning: (archaic, figurative) To utter with authority or vehemence; fulminate.
examples: She fulmined out her scorn of laws Salique.
